results.title: Vision Pro Shift Reveals New Focus On AI Glasses In 2025 – Why It Matters - Glass Almanac
results.content:
Apple redirected development from a Vision Pro overhaul toward compact AI glasses by Oct 1, 2025.

## Which strategic risks and opportunities emerge for Apple and partners in 2026

Shifting focus reduces near-term hardware risk but raises two big questions for Apple and its suppliers: can software-led features (Apple Intelligence, spatial widgets) drive volume without a dramatically cheaper chassis? And can third-party developers monetize spatial experiences if the install base fragments between premium headsets and lighter glasses? Suppliers may face canceled or delayed orders, while startups pitching companion apps could win fresh attention. If you build for AR, re-scope roadmaps now.

## What this shift means for early adopters and Apple’s AR plans in 2026? [...] Apple launched Vision Pro at $3,499, and subsequent software pushes-like visionOS 26-aimed to boost value but didn’t erase adoption barriers. Media coverage through mid-2025 showed slow consumer traction, prompting Apple to prioritize smaller, AI-enabled glasses. The strategic shift leans on software (Apple Intelligence) rather than aggressive hardware upgrades.

See also  "Smart Move, Just Late" Sparks Alarm Over 30% Metaverse Cuts In 2025 - Here's Why

## The numbers that change the game for Vision Pro in 2025

| KPI | Value + Unit | Change/Impact |
 --- 
| Launch price | $3,499 | Limited consumer uptake vs mass-market devices |
| Overhaul pause date | Oct 1, 2025 | Resources redirected toward AI glasses |
| visionOS update | April 2025 | Apple Intelligence added, software focus grew | [...] ## What changes for developers and buyers after Apple’s 2025 pivot

> • Apple paused the Vision Pro overhaul on Oct 1, 2025; resources moved to AI glasses.
>
> • visionOS 26 added Apple Intelligence in April 2025; software updates increased Vision Pro capabilities.
>
> • Bloomberg and Reuters reported the pause; enterprise roadmap now prioritizes compact AR products.

## Why Apple’s 2025 Vision Pro shift accelerates the race to AR glasses

# Apple's Studio Display 2 Reportedly on Track to Launch This Year With These New Features

by Joe Rossignol

Apple plans to release a new version of the Studio Display "in the first half of 2026," according to the latest word from Bloomberg's Mark Gurman.

In his Power On newsletter on Sunday, Gurman noted that inventory of the current Studio Display is running low on Apple's online store and at its retail stores, although this has generally been the case for a while now. Extended shipping estimates on Apple's online store can sometimes hint at an upcoming product refresh. [...] See more guides
